t: Matthew 26
The Plot to Kill Jesus
When*p Jesus had finished all these words, He said to His disciples,
“You*r know*r that*r after*r two*r days*r the*r Passover*r is*r coming,*r and*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r is*r to*ir be*ir handed*r over*r for*r crucifixion.”*r
Then*p the chief priests and the elders of the people were gathered together in the court of the high priest, named Caiaphas;
and they plotted together to seize Jesus by stealth and kill Him.
But they were saying, “Not during the festival, otherwise a riot might occur among the people.”
The Precious Ointment
Now*p when Jesus was in Bethany, at the home of Simon the leper,
a woman came to Him with an alabaster vial of very costly perfume, and she poured it on His head as He reclined at*i the*i table.*i
But the disciples were indignant when they saw this,*i and said, “Why this waste?
For this perfume*i might have been sold for a high price and the*i money*i given to the poor.”
But Jesus, aware of this, said to them, “Why*r do*r you*r bother*r the*r woman?*r For*r she*r has*r done*r a*r good*r deed*r to*r Me.*r
For*r you*r always*r have*r the*r poor*r with*r you;*r but*r you*r do*r not*r always*r have*r Me.*r
For*r when*r she*r poured*r this*r perfume*r on*r My*r body,*r she*r did*r it*r to*r prepare*r Me*r for*r burial.*r
Truly*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r wherever*r this*r gospel*r is*r preached*r in*r the*r whole*r world,*r what*r this*r woman*r has*r done*r will*r also*r be*r spoken*r of*r in*r memory*r of*r her.”*r
Judas’s Bargain
Then*p one of the twelve, named Judas Iscariot, went to the chief priests
and said, “What are you willing to give me to betray Him to you?” And they weighed out thirty pieces of silver to him.
From then on he began*i looking for a good opportunity to betray Jesus.
Now*p on the first day*i of Unleavened Bread the disciples came to Jesus and asked, “Where do You want us to prepare for You to eat the Passover?”

And He said, “Go*r into*r the*r city*r to*r a*r certain*r man,*r and*r say*r to*r him,*r ‘The*r Teacher*r says,*r “My*r time*r is*r near;*r I*r am*ir to*ir keep*r the*r Passover*r at*r your*r house*r with*r My*r disciples.” ’ ”*r
The disciples did as Jesus had directed them; and they prepared the Passover.
The Last Passover
Now*p when evening came, Jesus was reclining at*i the*i table*i with the twelve disciples.
As they were eating, He said, “Truly*r I*r say*r to*r you*r that*r one*r of*r you*r will*r betray*r Me.”*r
Being deeply grieved, they each one began to say to Him, “Surely not I, Lord?”
And He answered, “He*r who*r dipped*r his*r hand*r with*r Me*r in*r the*r bowl*r is*r the*r one*r who*r will*r betray*r Me.*r

The*r Son*r of*r Man*r is*ir to*ir go,*r just*r as*r it*r is*r written*r of*r Him;*r but*r woe*r to*r that*r man*r by*r whom*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r is*r betrayed!*r It*r would*r have*r been*r good*r for*r that*r man*r if*r he*r had*r not*r been*r born.”*r
And Judas, who was betraying Him, said, “Surely it is not I, Rabbi?” Jesus said to him, “You*r have*r said*r it*ir yourself.”*r
The Lord’s Supper Instituted
While*p they were eating, Jesus took some*i bread, and after a blessing, He broke it*i and gave it*i to the disciples, and said, “Take,*r eat;*r this*r is*r My*r body.”*r
And when He had taken a cup and given thanks, He gave it*i to them, saying, “Drink*r from*r it,*r all*r of*r you;*r
for*r this*r is*r My*r blood*r of*r the*r covenant,*r which*r is*r poured*r out*r for*r many*r for*r forgiveness*r of*r sins.*r

But*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r I*r will*r not*r drink*r of*r this*r fruit*r of*r the*r vine*r from*r now*r on*r until*r that*r day*r when*r I*r drink*r it*r new*r with*r you*r in*r My*r Father’s*r kingdom.”*r
After*p singing a hymn, they went out to the Mount of Olives.

Then*p Jesus said to them, “You*r will*r all*r fall*r away*r because*r of*r Me*r this*r night,*r for*r it*r is*r written,*r ‘I*r will*sr strike*sr down*sr the*sr shepherd,*sr and*sr the*sr sheep*sr of*sr the*sr flock*sr shall*sr be*sr scattered.’*sr
But*r after*r I*r have*r been*r raised,*r I*r will*r go*r ahead*r of*r you*r to*r Galilee.”*r
But Peter said to Him, “Even*i though all may fall away because of You, I will never fall away.”
Jesus said to him, “Truly*r I*r say*r to*r you*r that*r this*r very*ir night,*r before*r a*r rooster*r crows,*r you*r will*r deny*r Me*r three*r times.”*r
Peter said to Him, “Even if I have to die with You, I will not deny You.” All the disciples said the same thing too.
The Garden of Gethsemane
Then*p Jesus came with them to a place called Gethsemane, and said to His disciples, “Sit*r here*r while*r I*r go*r over*r there*r and*r pray.”*r
And He took with Him Peter and the two sons of Zebedee, and began to be grieved and distressed.
Then He said to them, “My*r soul*r is*r deeply*r grieved,*r to*r the*r point*r of*r death;*r remain*r here*r and*r keep*r watch*r with*r Me.”*r

And*p He went a little beyond them,*i and fell on His face and prayed, saying, “My*r Father,*r if*r it*r is*r possible,*r let*r this*r cup*r pass*r from*r Me;*r yet*r not*r as*r I*r will,*r but*r as*r You*r will.”*r
And He came to the disciples and found them sleeping, and said to Peter, “So,*r you*r men*ir could*r not*r keep*r watch*r with*r Me*r for*r one*r hour?*r
Keep*r watching*r and*r praying*r that*r you*r may*r not*r enter*r into*r temptation;*r the*r spirit*r is*r willing,*r but*r the*r flesh*r is*r weak.”*r
He*p went away again a second time and prayed, saying, “My*r Father,*r if*r this*r cannot*r pass*r away*r unless*r I*r drink*r it,*r Your*r will*r be*r done.”*r
Again He came and found them sleeping, for their eyes were heavy.
And He left them again, and went away and prayed a third time, saying the same thing once more.

Then He came to the disciples and said to them, “Are*r you*r still*r sleeping*r and*r resting?*r Behold,*r the*r hour*r is*r at*r hand*r and*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r is*r being*r betrayed*r into*r the*r hands*r of*r sinners.*r
Get*r up,*r let*r us*r be*r going;*r behold,*r the*r one*r who*r betrays*r Me*r is*r at*r hand!”*r
Jesus’ Betrayal and Arrest
While*p He was still speaking, behold, Judas, one of the twelve, came up accompanied by a large crowd with swords and clubs, who*i came*i from the chief priests and elders of the people.
Now he who was betraying Him gave them a sign, saying, “Whomever I kiss, He is the one; seize Him.”
Immediately Judas went to Jesus and said, “Hail, Rabbi!” and kissed Him.
And Jesus said to him, “Friend,*r do*ir what*r you*r have*r come*r for.”*r Then they came and laid hands on Jesus and seized Him.
And*p behold, one of those who were with Jesus reached and drew out his sword, and struck the slave of the high priest and cut off his ear.
Then Jesus said to him, “Put*r your*r sword*r back*r into*r its*r place;*r for*r all*r those*r who*r take*r up*r the*r sword*r shall*r perish*r by*r the*r sword.*r
Or*r do*r you*r think*r that*r I*r cannot*r appeal*r to*r My*r Father,*r and*r He*r will*r at*r once*r put*r at*r My*r disposal*r more*r than*r twelve*r legions*r of*r angels?*r
How*r then*r will*r the*r Scriptures*r be*r fulfilled,*r which*ir say*ir that*r it*r must*r happen*r this*r way?”*r

At*p that time Jesus said to the crowds, “Have*r you*r come*r out*r with*r swords*r and*r clubs*r to*r arrest*r Me*r as*r you*ir would*ir against*r a*r robber?*r Every*r day*r I*r used*r to*r sit*r in*r the*r temple*r teaching*r and*r you*r did*r not*r seize*r Me.*r
But*r all*r this*r has*r taken*r place*r to*r fulfill*r the*r Scriptures*r of*r the*r prophets.”*r Then all the disciples left Him and fled.
Jesus before Caiaphas
Those*p who had seized Jesus led Him away to Caiaphas, the high priest, where the scribes and the elders were gathered together.
But Peter was following Him at a distance as far as the courtyard of the high priest, and entered in, and sat down with the officers to see the outcome.
Now*p the chief priests and the whole Council kept trying to obtain false testimony against Jesus, so that they might put Him to death.
They did not find any,*i even though many false witnesses came forward. But later on two came forward,
and said, “This man stated, ‘I am able to destroy the temple of God and to rebuild it in three days.’ ”
The high priest stood up and said to Him, “Do You not answer? What is it that these men are testifying against You?”
But Jesus kept silent. And the high priest said to Him, “I adjure You by the living God, that You tell us whether You are the Christ, the Son of God.”

Jesus said to him, “You*r have*r said*r it*r yourself;*ir nevertheless*r I*r tell*r you,*r hereafter*r you*r will*r see*r the*sr Son*sr of*sr Man*sr sitting*sr at*sr the*sr right*sr hand*sr of*sr Power,*sr and*r coming*sr on*sr the*sr clouds*sr of*sr heaven.”*sr
Then*p the high priest tore his robes and said, “He has blasphemed! What further need do we have of witnesses? Behold, you have now heard the blasphemy;
what do you think?” They answered, “He deserves death!”
Then*p they spat in His face and beat Him with their fists; and others slapped Him,
and said, “Prophesy to us, You Christ; who is the one who hit You?”
Peter’s Denials
Now*p Peter was sitting outside in the courtyard, and a servant-girl came to him and said, “You too were with Jesus the Galilean.”
But he denied it*i before them all, saying, “I do not know what you are talking about.”
When he had gone out to the gateway, another servant-girl*i saw him and said to those who were there, “This man was with Jesus of Nazareth.”
And again he denied it*i with an oath, “I do not know the man.”
A little later the bystanders came up and said to Peter, “Surely you too are one*i of them; for even the way you talk gives you away.”
Then he began to curse and swear, “I do not know the man!” And immediately a rooster crowed.
And Peter remembered the word which Jesus had said, “Before*r a*r rooster*r crows,*r you*r will*r deny*r Me*r three*r times.”*r And he went out and wept bitterly.
